DataElement.preferredName: Leiomyosarcoma and Endometrial Stromal Sarcoma American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Pathologic Distant Metastasis M Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for the leiomyosarcoma and endometrial stromal sarcoma based on evidence obtained from pathologic examination through completion of definitive surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Leiomyosarcoma and Endometrial Stromal Sarcoma Pathologic M Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant mesenchymal tumor arising from the wall of the uterine corpus (uterine body).  The most representative examples are leiomyosarcoma and endometrial stromal sarcoma. -- 2004_Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant mesenchymal tumor arising from the wall of the uterine corpus (uterine body).  The most representative examples are leiomyosarcoma and endometrial stromal sarcoma. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from the wall of the uterine corpus (uterine body).  The most representative examples are leiomyosarcoma and endometrial stromal sarcoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CRF standard harmonization. Released per final community approval. mc 5/7/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: Leiomyosarcoma and Endometrial Stromal Sarcoma American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Pathologic M Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of leiomyosarcoma and endometrial stromal sarcoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.  There is no pathologic M0.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Leiomyosarcoma and Endometrial Stromal Sarcoma pM1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Leiomyosarcoma and Endometrial Stromal Sarcoma pM1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distant metastasis (excluding adnexa, pelvic and abdominal tissues). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Leiomyosarcoma and Endometrial Stromal Sarcoma pM1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Distant metastasis (excluding adnexa, pelvic and abdominal tissues). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

Concepts.definition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of leiomyosarcoma and endometrial stromal sarcoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.  There is no pathologic M0.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

The extent of a cancer in the body.
